CatDescriptText: image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 14, 1961, pg. 11, reads: "Granted D.I. Name - These glamorous ladies, who belong to the victorious faction of the split D.I. Club, Inc., are shown with Judge Clarence B. Nixon, who recently granted them the right to use the name, and Atty. Byrd R. Brown, who waged the successful battle for them in court. Left to right are: Gloria Grate, Nellye Baron, Margaret Watson and Juanita Drake."
TitMainTitle: Judge Clarence B. Nixon seated at desk, with Byrd Brown and members of D. I. Club Inc. Gloria Golden Grate, Nellye Baron, Margaret Watson and Juanita Drake standing, gathered in office
